stance.audience: People preparing tap water storage at home
stance.promise: Clean and disinfect any water container correctly before filling

claims_checklist: Include materials check: food-grade HDPE, no dairy/juice residue containers
Provide step-by-step sanitization with unscented bleach, and safe rinse
State bleach concentrations (common 5–8.25%) and per-liter/mL guidance
Include label/date instructions and rotation cadence (6–12 months)
At least 3 authoritative sources and 1 caution about fumes/skin contact

quotes.quote: Use household bleach (5–9% sodium hypochlorite) for disinfecting water containers.
After sanitizing with bleach, rinse thoroughly with safe drinking water before filling.
Label containers with date and contents; rotate stored water every six to twelve months.
